3 o'clock.defaultValue: 0 deg in the plane of the LCD.

6 o'clock.defaultValue: 270 deg in the plane of the LCD.

9 o'clock.defaultValue: 180 deg in the plane of the LCD.

10 o'clock.defaultValue: 150 deg in the plane of the LCD.

5 o'clock.defaultValue: 300 deg in the plane of the LCD.

12 o'clock.defaultValue: 90 deg in the plane of the LCD.

description:
code of the viewing direction of a liquid crystal display.
During the manufacturing process the orientation layers of an LCD can be treated such that a so-called preferred viewing direction can be built in. In this direction the display contrast is maximum. A 6 o'clock view means a preferred view from below (270 deg in the plane of the LCD), whereas a 12 o'clock (or 90 deg) preferred view implies a preference from above. The exact elevation angle is not taken into account.
